snippet: In his first address as commissioner, William J. Bratton said the department’s progress in reducing crime should long ago have given way to fewer confrontational encounters with the public.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton, in his first address in office, signals intention to shift police department away from aggressive style of patrolling city that has alienated many minority residents; says that tremendous strides department has made in reducing crime should long ago have given way to fewer confrontational encounters between police and public.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: In his first address as commissioner, William J. Bratton said the department’s progress in reducing crime should long ago have given way to fewer confrontational encounters with the public.

headline.main: Bratton Takes Helm of Police Force He Pledged to Change
headline.print_headline: Bratton Vows to Steer Police Away From Aggressive Tactics
